comments.text: best point to get Brest. Waited for 5 minutes with my friend!
Her a direct ride to Brest!
the success 99%, proved the point.
very bood point with a big  capabilities & light

to Brest, Poland:
take Metro to the 'Istytut Kul'tury' station (1st(blue) line), then take the bus #32, #41, #103, #117, #120 to 'Druzhba' station, then  take the bus #28, #90, #132 to 'Pavarot na Malinauku' station, get out and walk 200m SW

You can get there by bus 1 from the railway station. Cars go quite slow. Plenty of space to pull over. I caught a truck in 5 min. No need to go further because the road dives down after this spot and you won't be visible.

u can go here by the local train(diesel multiple unit) from Molodechno to Listopady(Листопады/Лістапады). there is Lida direction. ticket costs ~0,3 EUR. time to get here is 1hr.

u need to walk from Listopady station 1km to the hh-position
Good spot if you going to Minsk. Waited about 15 min and got a ride wright to the center of city. (Time: about 8 p.m.)
Once you've walked through the border pretty much everything coming through will be going your way.  A sign for Minsk had me picked up in minutes.
Good place to get to the Gomel
A very good spot near the circle junction. Cars go slow and often stop.
a good spot for going to Minsk. Cars go slowly after the traffic lights.
good place to get car

I am not really sure this is the exact place, anyway, trolleybus n.5 and marshrutka n. 20 & 29, drive you all the way to a place very close to the highway to Minsk/Gomel, just ask the driver or somebody else. To get a ride was really easy from here, in the morning.
It really depends. Once I got a ride pretty fast and once I waited for a couple of hours. I don't see any point in walking further.
Walk through all the borders - it seems they never end.  It'll take you a couple of kilometres, but once through properly to the Ukrainian side, you'll have no problem.  A ride to Kiev in minutes.
Try walking some 10 km to the south, virtually nobody is willing to stop here.
Yes, lots of place to stop, though in our case practically nobody went all the way to the border. Many cars stopped for us, though.
A lot of place to stop, just after the stop lights so cars go slow.
to Ukraine
to Klieck and Niasviž
There's a point in going to this place because a lot of cars actually turn at the crossroads either left or right.
many local hitchhikers here too. after 1 hour all 5 had been picked up, so the spot is pretty good.
Take trolley bus 1 or 5 to get her. You can stand right after the traffic lights or walk a bit further to the next spot. Plenty of space for cars to stop. You can use this spot at night as well.
Direction - Moscow. You can come here by walking for 30 minutes from Navasady station.
Place of hitch-hiking start from Lida to Minsk. Often you are given a lift to the road junction.
Good place at the descent from the bridge, opposite gas station. A lot of cars go to Minsk
Not bad spot, but many cars goes to Ditva and other villages. at the bus station you can get bus 11  to the turning to hospital in Ostrovliya.

we caught a car to Grodno in 20 min. place is good, cars are not fast, so they can see you. the biggest problem was to get to this spot from the metrostation. it took about 20 min, and we needed to cross Minsk Road Road and there were no crosswalks...

to Grodno(Hrodna), Vilnius(LT):
Take Metro (2nd line(red) 'Avtozavodskaya linija') to 'Kamennaya Horka', get off and go west towards M9 (~2km). Try to hh right after on-ramp from M9 to M6
You can get here by tram from the railway station.

You can get here by bus from Navapolatsk autostation to Dzisna. The bus stop is named "Biazdziedavičy" ("Bezdedovichy" at Russian).

It is good place to hitch the car to Braslaw.
Good vehicles frequency and they don't arrive too fast. Also there is enough room for trucks to stop there.
Good vehicles frequency. Cars can stop here. Good spot to go to Полоцк (Polatsk).

Nice spot to go to Лепель (lepiel) or Полоцк (Polotsk). The only issue is the low frequency of the cars entering the M3. But eventually I didn't have to wait more than 15 minutes. The driver dropped me to Бегомль (Begoml) from where I easily hitchhiked to Polatsk.

from Metro "могилевская"  bus 112.
Direction to Mogilev, Gomel/

It's a good place if you don't mind asking drivers directly.
 Though a lot of cars go just across the border to Teresol or Biała Podlaska only. And it will take from 30 minutes up to some hours to cross the border even when you are already in a car. 
 Be sure that you don't have more alcohol and cigarets than it is allowded. You will be asked at the Polish side.

To Warsaw:
From trolleybus last stop 'Ordzhonikidze' near Railway Station walk ~250m along 'Komsomolskaya' street to the stop 'Komsomolskaya'. From here take marshrutka #1 and get off when it turns left from E30 (stop 'Cafe'). Then walk 600m along the main road (E30) to the gates and ask drivers
There's always the chance of a ride to the border at least.  40Km away.
to Ukraine
Much better here for Gomel.  Picked up in seconds.
Towards Homiel
Good spot with lots of traffic.  Don't be put off by locals hitching here - it's a popular place for getting rides.

to Bobruisk, Gomel, Mozyr, Kyiv (UA):
Take Metro (2nd line (red)  'Avtozavodskaya linija') to 'Mahileuskaya' station, then take a bus #512 to Sokal get off at the junction with M1. You can try hitching just after the junction or walk 1.5 km east towards junction of M4 (towards Mahileu) and M5 (towards Homel') roads.
There is enough place for cars to stop near the bus stop.Not that many cars go towards Ukraine but still it's possible to get a ride.
A good place to go towards Brest as M1 highway (Warsaw-Moscow) and P1 (from Miensk) join here.
For Minsk.
M-8 Cars go quite fast but I've never waited too long here. Cars turning from M-1 go slow and it's usually them that pick up people. However, it depends)))
Not enough place for a car to pull off but still quite a good place beacuse the traffic is not very fast here.
There is a very beautiful 15th century church in Synkavichy. It's built in the so called Belarusian gothic style.
Cars go fairly slow but there are few of them here (the usual effect of a near-by border). Quite a good opportunity to stop a truck to St.Petersburg.
A very good spot for going to St.Petersburg.
Right after, on, or next to the gas station is a GREAT spot when going to Lithuania. It's only 10 more km to the border so every car is going there. The first car stopped.

The spot is just after the road splits - one way to Hrodna, the other to Vilnius.  When going to Vilnius this is a pretty good spot, enough place to stop and not too much traffic - most of the trucks go to LT
alt.way to LT

to Mogilev:
Take Metro (2nd line (red)  'Avtozavodskaya linija') to 'Mahileuskaya' station, then take a bus #512 to Sokal get off at the junction with M1. You can try hitching just after the junction or walk 1.5 km east towards junction of M4 (towards Mahileu) and M5 (towards Homel') roads.

towards Moscow, Russia (day-time):
take Metro (2nd line 'Avtozavodskaya linija') to 'Mahileuskaya', then take a bus #512 to 'Sokal' get off at the turn from M1 to 'Sokal'. Spot is right after this crossroad.
Although there were 15 other hitchhikers when I arrived the cars stop a lot. Just make sure to say you are going without money.
halo

to Borisov, Moscow(RU) (for night-time hh):
take Metro (1st line(blue)) to 'Uruchcha' station, then get the bus #15, #99, #263 to '9-yj kilometr' station, get out and walk 0.5km NE along the road. The spot is right after junction
Met two Russian Hitchhikers here who told me they had already waited 10 hours spread out over two days. We got a ride for the three of us within another hour though
gas station on the highway from Brest to Minsk.
enough space to stop but expect long waiting times
You can get here also by bus 115э ("э" means "express") (from DS Družnaja or the bus stop "Valhahradskaja" near Maskoŭskaja metro station to the bus stop "Baraŭliany-6").

Cars go quite fast but still it's better to hitch-hike here than just behind the encircling highway because drivers often ask for money there. You can get here by buses 113 and 113a (the bus stop 'Pavarot na Malinauku' - 'Turn to Malinauka')

I wanted to cross the border to Latvia, many cars did stop but none of them were going to Latvia. It took one hour to finally find a truck that was heading there. But once we reached the border I had to change there because there was a huge truck queue. Still it took me 5 hours to cross. If you really want to cross the border with hitchhiking, better go to the gas station that is 50 meters in front of this spot. Cars stop there before crossing the border. This is what a local advised me. For non
towards Homiel
to Gomel
Too many locals come to hitch-hike here and all of them pay so the drivers here are used to getting money. Not a very good spot.
Vey few people stop, although cars go very slow after the post. I think it's better to walk some kilometers ahead or to accept a short ride to the nearest town of Nevel.
near bus-stop
good road after repairs with illumination
good road after repairs with illumination
normal postion near bus-stop 2 LT direction
Slow speed before bend in the road, but your waiting can be long.Better to walk several kilometers(4km) to the next fork
Нужно успеть показать водителю, что тебе хотя-бы до Кольца. Либо пройти пешком эти 3 км, если есть время.
halo
merhaba

So a truck brought me to the border but there was a huge queue. It could have taken more than a day to cross with him. So I waited for a car to come since controls are faster for them. But there are very very few of them and they seem to be reluctant to pick up hitchhikers to the border due to possible control complications. So I had to cross with a truck ahead on the queue (them too were reluctant for the same reasons). It took about 4-5 hours to complete all border controls.
So if you want to
The district is getting more and more developed. So it's better to choose a spot closer to the end of the city.
Take Metro (2nd line 'Avtozavodskaya linija') to 'Kamennaya Horka', get off walk 50m (direction west) and hitch right from the bus stop.
Maybe a bad time of day, but hardly any traffic to Gomel.  Use the other spot instead.
to Gomel
Too many trucks going too fast to pull over and too few cars. A usual situation before the border. One can wait here for hours(((
It's quite hilly here and there's virtually no place for a car to pull off. A bad spot.
to Zhaludok. very few cars

HH on this road is almost sensless: on my way to Dzitkovichi I got few short rides and I spent a long time waiting on the road. Nevertheless, the people who picked me up made it worth (and we nad no languages in common). Hitching here you will experience the countryside, its stillness and the carachter who populate it. Bring enough food and water!
to Gomel
Drivers often drop you here. Go ahead a kilometre or so and then hitch-hike. The best variant is to get to the circle junction which is some 5 km farther.
